DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a lined hazmat tote

item.title: Report E-2023050557
item.description:
Report E-2023050557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T06:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 5, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was punctured during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services, Inc. (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. EHS personnel utilized granular absorbents and swept them in using hand tools. The crew containerized all impacted material into one (1) 5-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023050394
item.description:
Report X-2023050394

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T06:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: Denver
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 12-16 oz cartons in a box, one carton was punctured. It appears as though it was punctured by a forklift though the OM discovered the spill, it was not reported to him, so he was unsure the time of the puncture and which operator, though he advised he would check cameras. OM advised he would clean u p the spill, no crew required.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-15T06:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-27
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN3266 Liquid 90 release from 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-ounces of product released to the lids only of (3) 55-gallon poly drums due to loose caps. The caps were tightened, secured, and a slosh test preformed on the drums to ensure there would be no further release. The drums were wiped down and all impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: AURORA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to have been leaking inside of a van during the outbound sort. A manager picked the package up to take to a safe segregated area when the package leaked on their pants. The liquid began to cause a burning sensation on the leg. SDS was found and first aid treatment administered as per the SDS's instructions. Package was then segregated by QA for further inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found to have been repacked, according to the SPIDR images, this took place at the origin station. DescribePack: One bottle was found with cap completely loose and another with some contents already missing but cap tightly secured, further evidencing a previous repack. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was segregated into a damage tote to ensure no further damage to persons or property. First aid was given to the injured manager.

  • Description: At 11:04 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UDV. It was reported that approximately 1 quart of UN 1866 944WJ480 Base White was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum falling off of the pallet during dock operations. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal placed the damaged drum and cleanup debris into an 85-gallon metal drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The GATX 68385 was found with liquid on the top protective housing and sides of the car, no ground impacts reported. Upon inspection, the release appears to originated from the pressure release device (75 psi valve). The car and all fittings were inspected and the car tested with nitrogen to identify release path. A release point was not identified and all fittings and closures were secured. A hydraulic surge during transportation was the cause of the release through the PRV.

  • Description: BJCA station called in with a package that felt cold to the touch, and they stated that this shipper has shipped Dry Ice in the past. DG Admin instructed them to open the package and they found it did contain Dry Ice and what appeared to be blood samples. Dg Admin instructed them to re-seal the package, and contact the shipper in order to get a release form to place a dry ice label on the package in order to send it on to destination. The attached photos are all that were provided. There are no indications on the outside package that shows this package contains dry ice.

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-14
  • City: COMMERCE CITY
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 14, 2023, at 2400 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Commerce City, Colorado regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of Lime-A-Way (Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s., UN3265, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug. The release was reportedly due to a puncture and was contained to the shipping pallet. No drains or waterways were reported as affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The released product, affected cargo and all other waste generated were containerized in (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste drums were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a release from two boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 4' x 2' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture to each box. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged and leaky jugs were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted absorbents rags, poly sheeting and cleanup debris were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1511 ET, XPO terminal UDV reported a spill that occurred inside a trailer located in Henderson, CO. The spill consisted of (1) 270-gallon plastic tote of NA1993 "Huskie EC347", which was punctured by another pallet while unloading cargo from the trailer, causing the tote to release. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 2' x 53' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 4' area of the concrete lot due to a puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: INSPECTED CONTENTS OF NINE PACKAGES DUE TO ONE PACKAGE NEEDING TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE EACH PACKAGE. OUTER BOXES ARE IMPRINTED AS PERISHABLE HANDLE WITH CARE. ALL NINE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS LOCTIONS IN THE USA. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS ARE 1Z8YW1711297489660, 1Z8YW1710296185606, 1Z8YW1710294636140, 1Z8YW1710292563562, 1Z8YW1710291648099, 1Z8YW1710298250737, 1Z8YW1710298697747 AND 1Z8YW1710294581388.

item.title: Report E-2023020302
item.description:
Report E-2023020302

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-14T21:08:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UDV experienced a UN1380 "Max S" release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3' X 10' area outside the trailer on concrete and an 8' X 5' area inside the trailer due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and the impacted pallet were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UDV experienced a release of UN1263 Axalta HL White Primer from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 5' x 5' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All waste was containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023010081
item.description:
Report I-2023010081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-14T21:08:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-07
  • City: Denver
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/7/2023 at approximately 0730, Dangers Goods Administration received a call from Employee 625959 at the ramp facility in Denver, reporting an undeclared resin spill. The shipment was a 23-piece shipment of resin in plastic drums, each holding 7.57 liters. Spillage was discovered on the aircraft floor. One of the drums was discovered cracked across the bottom, resulting in leakage. Further investigation and the enclosed SDS revealed that the shipment shipped undeclared being void of the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork in accordance with IATA Regulations. The aircraft floor was cleaned and cleared to return to service. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT 063 0ET XPO logistics terminal UDV called to report an active release that has expelled at least one gallon of Carbamate Lannate to the dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to the dock floor in an 8' x 5' due to a forklift puncture. Crew collected 7 boxes of impacted jugs which were damaged and impacted and placed them along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Passenger Sheila Rigg was traveling from Colorado Springs to Salt Lake City on Delta flight 4164. While her checked bag containing a HP model: 11-y010wm ProdID: X7V31UAS/N: 5CD63129N9 was being screened by TSA. The TSA agents noted the HP laptop was swollen in the location the battery is housed. The TSA removed the laptop from the baggage and notified Delta airlines. The laptop was removed and was not allowed to travel with the passenger. There was no release, meeting dangerous evolution of heat reporting requirement.

  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 19, 2022, at 1854 ET. Circle K reported UN1203 "Gasoline" released 30-gallons from a 8700-gallons from a cargo tanker due to a single vehicle accident. The tanker arrived at the gas station and turned a tight corner into a steel pole damaging the loading hose. ERTS dispatched Allied International Emergency (Allied) to perform all onsite clean up operations. On November 19, 2022, at 2120 ET, Allied arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of gasoline released impacting a 35-feet (ft.) by 15-ft. area of concrete and a 30-gallon metal drum containing 5-gallons of gasoline. Allied utilized absorbents to clean the impacted concrete areas. Allied collected and containerized the impacted absorbents into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Allied transported the (1) 55-gallon metal drum gasoline impacted absorbents and the 30-gallon metal drum containing the 5-gallons of gasoline off site for disposal.

  • Description: At 1450 ET, XPO terminal UDV contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside trailer #3114605 in Henderson, CO. The spill consisted of (1) 55 gallon metal drum of Fencecoat Black, which was damaged due to not being strapped in properly prior to transit and being punctured by an adjacent pallet, releasing approximately 8 ounces onto the floor. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8 ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a punctured drum. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into an 85 gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal UDV called in to report a 55-gallon plastic drum of UN3266 Enforce LP releasing material from the top of the drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released to a 4" x 4" area of the drum lid due to residual generated during drum loading. The cap was tightened, and a slosh test confirmed no further leak would occur. Absorbent pads were used to wipe up released product and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal UDV called in to report a 0.5-cup spill of UN1760 CIRCUPOSIT CONDITIONER 3320 A from a 5-gallon poly pail caused by a puncture from a nail from a broken pallet and impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to respond. Contractors arrived onsite and advised Tthe area where the spill happened was already cleaned by terminal personnel. Terminal personnel placed the absorbents and the damaged 5-gallon pail in a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors removed the waste form the metal drum and re-containerized the waste into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0620 ET, XPO reported a spill in Henderson CO. XPO advised that one 4-gallon metal pail of UN1268 was released onto the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Cleaning Guys to conduct cleanup. At 0930 ET, CG personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected along with the damaged pail into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110024
item.description:
Report E-2022110024

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-19
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal UDV contacted ERTS to report a three-ounce spill of regulated UN1813 "DRY CAUSTIC POTASH" that was released from a 50-pound plastic bag. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1700 ET, EnviroServe personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor from three damaged bags. The bags released due to tears caused by other pallets loaded in the trailer. The damaged bags, released product, and all cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment onto the consignee. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On October 20, 2022, ten (10) one-gallon pails of UN1219 were dropped during unloading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor.   • Description: Tilx 101622 was found leaking in the UPRR Denver North Yard. Upon investigation it was found that the blind flange on the liquid line was missing 1 bolt and 2 of the 3 that were installed were less than tool tight. The gasket was checked and in good condition. The flange was secured, missing bolt was replaced, and the released product was neutralized. The car was released to destination.

  • State: CO

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 12, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Zinplex 15 22EC9011 (UN1760) toppled during transit due to a collapsed pallet and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services (EHS) to perform the necessary corrective actions. EHS personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all spent absorbents into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2022090276
item.description:
Report I-2022090276

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-14T21:08:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: Denver
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/08/2022 at approximately 1415, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5142794 at the station location in Denver, reporting an undeclared shipment containing ammunition. The package was part of a 2-piece shipment, containing about 20 individual boxes of live rounds. Due to the worn outer packaging, one box of live rounds escaped the package. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, omitting the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. Shipment is now being help, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UDV reported 53-gallons of UN3109 Organic Peroxide from (1) 55-gallon poly drum impacting the dock due to a forklift puncture. Contractors arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released affecting a 50 x 30 area of the dock floor. Contractors collected and containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallons overpacked poly drum and all clean-up debris into three (3) 55-gallons poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
